short_summary: The contract is for the Office Furniture Installation or Reconfiguration Service.
description: The Ministry of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is seeking to contract for office furniture installation or reconfiguration service on behalf of Shared Services Canada.
full_summary:
### New Office Fit-Up – Shared Services Canada (SSC) Barrie, Ontario

#### Public Service and Procurement Canada (PSPC) Solicitation

This document details a competitive bid solicitation for the installation of new office furniture at the Shared Services Canada (SSC) facility in Barrie, Ontario, as part of Phase 1 of the office fit-up project.

* **Notice Type:** Invitation to Qualify
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive – Open Bidding

**Scope**

The proposed scope of work entails the installation of office furniture at the Shared Services Canada facility in Barrie, Ontario. The successful bidder will be responsible for the installation of all furniture and fixtures, as per specifications provided in the bid package.

** Tender Details **
* **Solicitation Number:** WS4056962109
* **Amendment Number:** 4
* **Reference Number:** WS4056962109-Doc4057074850
* **Publication Date:** June 15, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** July 11, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT

**Important Notes**

Please note that the closing time has been modified to July 11, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT. All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be received by this time. Late bids will be considered non-responsive and will not be evaluated.

**Contact Information**

For any questions or concerns related to this solicitation, please contact Zobia Essa at zobia.essa@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

**Notice URL**

For access to the complete bid package and additional details, please visit: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16597914?extsite=MTY1OTc5MTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg== This link will take you to the Ariba Discovery posting for this solicitation.

**Notice Status**

The notice status for this solicitation is: Expiré (Expired in English) / Expiré (Expired in French)

Please note that trade agreements will be governed by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
